page.title: 03INDUSTRY IN HOLMES CHAPEL
page.content: Several important industrial enterprises are based in Holmes Chapel. The Victoria Mills opened as a wallpaper factory in 1911 and although there has been a reducation in output, wallpaper is still being made by FADS. Bengers opened a factory in 1937 which is now Fisons Pharmaceuticals. Research carried out in Holmes Chapel has led to the development of a drug to relieve breathing problems - sodium cromoglycate, marketed throughout the world as INTAL. The product was introduced in 1968 and its proven value has necessitated an expansion of production facilities to support the worldwide demand for the product. A mixture of light industry is situated along Manor Lane, including educational equipment, sportswear, computer equipment, packing, etc.
